topic.title: Install the F5 Driver and Agent

section.p: At the time of the Helion OpenStack 2.0 release, the F5 neutron-LBaaS driver is only available in the following file formats:
These formats cannot be directly installed by Helion OpenStack. Therefore it is necessary to manually install the driver using the following steps:

li.xref: Download the archives from the F5 Networks site
Extract the files relevant to BIG IP
Copy the files to the neutron virtual environment

section.title: Download the archives from the F5 Networks site
section.p: Before downloading files you must install the screen utility on the lifecycle manager (deployer node). Then make sure you have stopped all existing neutron LBaaS agents on the computer node before you can place the downloaded files into the neutron environment.
To download and extract the F5 files:

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager.
To install the screen utility, run: $ sudo apt-get install screen
To go to the directory where ansible playbooks are located, run: $ cd ~scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Create a file with the following name: neutron-lbaas-stop.yml

Add the following lines to the neutron-lbaas-stop.yml file, replacing names with those used in your environment: - hosts: NEU-LBAV2 sudo: yes roles: - neutron-common - neutron-lbaasv2-agent
tasks: - include: roles/neutron-lbaasv2-agent/tasks/stop.yml
- hosts: NEU-LBAV1 sudo: yes
tasks: - include: roles/neutron-lbaasv2-agent/tasks/stop.yml
To stop existing LBaaS agents using the ansible playbook, run: $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts neutron-lbaas-stop.yml
To verify that lbaas agents have stopped, run: $ neutron agent-listKeep in mind that it takes several minutes for an updated list to be shown by this command.
To download the F5 driver Debian files (Version 1.0.10), run: $ cd ~ $ wget --no-check-certificate -O F5.tgz https://devcentral.f5.com/d/openstack-neutron-lbaas-driver-and-agent?download=true

To verify the contents of the downloaded archive, run: $ md5sum F5.tgz
Sample outpute0a441b07874e7958de0bc5d733b9cca F5.tgz

section.note: You should repeat these steps for the high-availability and virtual tunnel endpoint netowrks before installing the LBaaS driver

section.title: Extract the files relevant to BIG IP
section.p: The extraction procedure will extract several files, however you are only interested in the files with the ".deb" extension. Then you must test running the F5 agent on multiple nodes.

p.b: To extract the files from the F5 .deb archives and test the agent:

ol.li: In the same directory where you downloaded the archive, run: $ tar xvfz F5.tgz

Copy the .deb archives onto appropriate nodes. Use the following guidelines:
The API driver goes onto all neutron API control plane nodes
The agent and common packages go on one control plane node

To test running the agent on multiple nodes, run the following commands: $ cd f5 $ scp f5-oslbaasv1-driver_1.0.10-1_all.deb stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt: $ scp f5-oslbaasv1-driver_1.0.10-1_all.deb stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m2-mgmt: $ scp f5-oslbaasv1-driver_1.0.10-1_all.deb stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m3-mgmt: $ scp f5-bigip-common_1.0.10-1_all.deb stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt: $ scp f5-oslbaasv1-agent_1.0.10-1_all.deb stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt:

section.title: Copy the files to the neutron virtual environment
section.p: Since the F5 .deb files are delivered by distribution packages, and Helion OpenStack expects the files to be under site packages, you must move the files to the expected location. Then you can edit the settings to identify the default load balancing service provider. Make sure you restart the neutron server when you are finished.
section.note: You must install the F5 API driver in the virtual environment. If the driver is not installed correctly, then you risk losing this driver if Helion OpenStack is upgraded or updated. For more information, refer to the Helion documentation onThird Party Driver Support.
section.p: To copy the files to the neutron virtual environment:

ol.li: To install the F5 API driver .deb files on all controller nodes, run the following commands: $ ssh stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt $ dpkg -x f5-oslbaasv1-driver_1.0.10-1_all.deb f5-driver $ cd f5-driver/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages $ sudo cp -rP * /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ $ sudo touch /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/f5/oslbaasv1driver/_init_.py

section.p: You can choose to either set F5 as the default load balancing service provider, or you can set another provider as the default. If you have multiple service providers, only one of them may have the ":default" tag.

section.title: To set F5 as the default load balancing service provider:
section.note: This process follows the Helion Lifecycle Manager process to push changes to all the controllers at the same time and to restart the neutron services.

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager (deployer node).
In a text editor, open the following file: ./scratch/ansible/next/my_cloud/config/neutron/neutron.conf.j2
Find the following service provider entry: LOADBALANCER:Haproxy
If you do not want to provide access to the HAProxy driver, delete the line containing the LOADBALANCER:Haproxy entry.
If you do want to provide access to the HAProxy driver, delete the following tag from the end of the line :default.

In the neutron.conf file you have open, add the following file: service_provider=LOADBALANCER:F5:f5.oslbaasv1driver.drivers.plugin_driver.F5PluginDri Only remove the ":default" tag for the HAPROXY line. The VPN line should have a ":default" tag at the end. If this is not configured correctly you will have issues getting the neutron-server service up and running.
Sample of a working neutron.conf file:
[service_providers] #service_provider = LOADBALANCERV2:Haproxy:neutron_lbaas.drivers.haproxy.plugin_driver.HaproxyOnHostPlugin # To enable LBaaSv1, comment the above service_provider line and uncomment the line below service_provider = LOADBALANCER:Haproxy:neutron.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.plugin_driver.HaproxyOnHostPluginDriver service_provider = VPN:openswan:neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.service_drivers.ipsec.IPsecVPNDriver:default service_provider = LOADBALANCER:F5:f5.oslbaasv1driver.drivers.plugin_driver.F5PluginDriver:default
Save the modified file.
To commit and apply the changes, follow the steps in HPE Helion Openstack: Using Git for Configuration Management.

section.title: Verify the F5 Driver is Running
section.p: Before installing the F5 agent, you must ensure that the F5 driver has successfully started.
To verify the F5 driver is running:

ol.li: Return to controller node one and open the following file: neutron-server

Verify the following conditions:
there are no stack traces
the driver has loaded

section.note: If the driver does not load, verify the existence of the following file in all the F5 subdirectories in the site packages: _init_.py

ol.li: To install the F5 agent code on one controller node, run the following commands: $ ssh stack@helion-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt $ sudo apt-get install python-suds # Needed by F5, not in hLinux. $ dpkg -x f5-bigip-common_1.0.10-1_all.deb f5-common $ dpkg -x f5-oslbaasv1-agent_1.0.10-1_all.deb f5-agent $ sudo cp -rP f5-common/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/f5/* /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/f5/ $ sudo cp -rP f5-agent/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/f5/* /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/f5/ $ sudo cp -rP f5-agent/etc/* /opt/stack/service/neutron/etc $ sudo cp -rP f5-agent/usr/bin/* /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/bin
In a text editor, open the following file: /opt/stack/service/neutron/etc/neutron/f5-oslbaasv1-agent.ini

Add the following lines to this file:
Code Description
f5_ha_type = standalone add this line if you are only using one F5 device
f5_vtep_selfip_name = 'VTEP' 'VTEP' is the default. Make sure this matches the selfIP name on the F5 device
icontrol_hostname = 10.1.36.5 this is the management IP address of the F5 device
Log in to the lifecycle manager (deployer node).
Run the agent under screen so that it will continue after disconnection.

Run the following commands: $ screen $ ssh stack@helion-cp1-c1-m1-mgmt $ cd /opt/stack/service/neutron/venv/bin $ sudo -u neutron bash # ./python2.7 f5-oslbaasv1-agent --config-file /opt/stack/service/neutron/etc/neutron.conf --config-file /opt/stack/service/neutron/etc/neutron/f5-oslbaasv1-agent.ini --log-file /var/log/neutron/f5.log

p.b: To confirm the F5 agent status:

ol.li: From deployer node or any controller node, run: neutron agent-list

Verify the following settings:
Item Status
f5-oslbaasv1-agent(Loadbalance agent binary) : - ) (alive status)
admin_state_up True
Login to the Horizon Dashboard with administrator credentials.
Click on Admin, then, System, then System Information, then Network Agents.

Verify the following settings:
Item Status
f5-oslbaasv1-agent(Loadbalance agent name) Enabled
State Up
